surveyDescription: Ford Standardized Information Gathering (SIG) Lite 2024 - High Availability Risk Operations Center Survey

questions.questionText: Is there a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements?
options: Yes, there is a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements
No, there is not a formalized risk governance plan approved by management that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No formalized Risk Governance policy that defines the Enterprise Risk Management program requirements

questions.questionText: Is there a third party risk management program that is reviewed and approved by management which includes 4th and Nth parties as part of the program?
options: Yes, there is a third party risk management program that is reviewed and approved by management which includes 4th and Nth parties as part of the program
No, there is not a third party risk management program that is reviewed and approved by management which includes 4th and Nth parties as part of the program
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No third party risk management program that is reviewed and approved by management which includes 4th and Nth parties as part of the program

questions.questionText: For all organizational entities (e.g., vendor's vendors, subcontractors, fourth parties, Nth parties) is there a contractual relationship that extends obligations to each entity?
options: Yes, there is a contractual relationship that extends obligations to each entity
No, there is not a contractual relationship that extends obligations to each entity
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No contractual relationship for all subcontractors.

questions.questionText: Has the organization implemented and documented an information security program and policy that is communicated, monitored, maintained, continually improved, and approved by management?
options: Yes, the organization has implemented and documented an information security program and policy that is communicated, monitored, maintained, continually improved, and approved by management
No, the organization has not implemented and documented an information security program and policy that is communicated, monitored, maintained, continually improved, and approved by management
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No information security policy or program that has been approved by management, published, and communicated to constituents

questions.questionText: Are information security personnel (internal or outsourced) responsible for information security processes?
options: Yes, there are information security personnel (internal or outsourced) responsible for information security processes.
No, there are no information security personnel (internal or outsourced) responsible for information security processes.
Not applicable

questions.questionText: Is there a documented risk assessment process for information security with consistent and comparable results?
options: Yes, there is a documented risk assessment process for information security with consistent and comparable results
No, there is not a documented risk assessment process for information security with consistent and comparable results
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No documented risk assessment process for information security

questions.questionText: Is there an asset management program approved by management, communicated to constituents and has an owner to maintain, review, and manage asset controls?
options: Yes, there is an asset management program approved by management, communicated to constituents and has an owner to maintain, review, and manage asset controls

Not applicable

questions.questionText: Is there an acceptable use policy for information and associated assets that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents, and assigned an owner to maintain and periodically review the policy?
options: Yes, there is an acceptable use policy for information and associated assets that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents, and assigned an owner to maintain and periodically review the policy

No, there is not an acceptable use policy for information and associated assets that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents, and assigned an owner to maintain and periodically review the policy

questions.questionText: Is there a records retention policy and retention schedule covering paper and electronic records, including email in support of applicable regulations, standards, and contractual requirements?
options: Yes, there is a records retention policy and retention schedule covering paper and electronic records, including email in support of applicable regulations, standards, and contractual requirements
No, there is not a records retention policy and retention schedule covering paper and electronic records, including email in support of applicable regulations, standards, and contractual requirements

questions.questionText: Is Information classified according to legal or regulatory requirements, business value, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification?
options: Yes, information is classified according to legal or regulatory requirements, business value, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification.
No, information is not classified according to legal or regulatory requirements, business value, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification.
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: Information is not classified according to legal or regulatory requirements, business value, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification.

questions.questionText: Does the organization have a process to inform personnel of legal and regulatory considerations of deployed AI system(s)?
questions.helpText: AI (Artificial Intelligence) systems may be subject to specific applicable legal and regulatory requirements. Some legal requirements can mandate (e.g., non-discrimination, data privacy and security controls) documentation, disclosure, and increased AI system transparency.
options: Yes, the organization does have a process to inform personnel of legal and regulatory considerations of the deployed AI system(s)
No, the organization does not have a process to inform personnel of legal and regulatory considerations of the deployed AI system(s)
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No process to inform personnel of legal and regulatory considerations of deployed AI (Artificial Intelligence) systems

questions.questionText: Do organizational policies, processes, and procedures include the characteristics of trustworthy AI?
questions.helpText:
Based on the EU (European Union) Commission, trustworthy AI should be:
 Lawful - respecting all applicable laws and regulations
 Ethical - respecting ethical principles and values
 Robust - both from a technical perspective while taking into account its social environment
options: Yes, organizational policies, processes, and procedures include the characteristics of trustworthy AI
No, organizational policies, processes, and procedures do not include the characteristics of trustworthy AI
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No documented policy, process or procedure that provides guidance on the permissible uses of internal and external AI (Artificial Intelligence) tools

questions.questionText: Does the organization establish policies that define the creation and maintenance of AI system inventories?
questions.helpText: An AI system inventory is an organized database of artifacts relating to an AI system or model. It may include system documentation, incident response plans, data dictionaries, links to implementation software or source code, names and contact information for relevant AI actors, or other information that may be helpful for model or system maintenance and incident response purposes.
options: Yes, the organization establish policies that define the creation and maintenance of AI system inventories
No, the organization does not establish policies that define the creation and maintenance of AI system inventories
Not applicable

givenAnswer.selectedOption: No policies that define the creation and maintenance of AI (Artificial Intelligence) system inventories
